com.xilinx.rapidwright.bitstream

Class ConfigRow

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.bitstream.ConfigRow

  • public class ConfigRow
extends Object
    Configuration row. For Series 7 devices, it keeps track of the top/bottom distinction and transition point (not relevant for other series devices).
    Since:
    2020.2.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigRow()
      Creates a new ConfigRow

      Block getBlockFromTileColumn(int tileColumnIdx)
      Gets the block in this configuration row based on the the tile column index in the fabric array.
      List<Block> getBlocks()
      Gets the raw list of blocks in this config row
      int getRowIndex()
      Gets the config row index as referenced from the Frame Address Register (FAR).
      static int getTopRowCRIndex(Device device)
      For a given device, gets the first clock region row that belongs to the top half of the configuration.
      boolean isTop()
      Flag indicating if this config row is in the top half of the array.

      Gets the number of blocks in this row.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigRow

        public ConfigRow()
        Creates a new ConfigRow
        Since:

    • Method Detail

      • getTopRowCRIndex

        public static int getTopRowCRIndex(Device device)
        For a given device, gets the first clock region row that belongs to the top half of the configuration. In all devices except Series 7, this is row 0.
        Parameters:
        device - The device of interest.
        Returns:
        The clock region row beginning the top configuration.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getRowIndex

        public int getRowIndex()
        Gets the config row index as referenced from the Frame Address Register (FAR).
        Returns:
        The FAR config row index of this config row.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • setRowIndex

        public void setRowIndex(int index)
        Sets the config row index as referenced from the Frame Address Register (FAR).
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • isTop

        public boolean isTop()
        Flag indicating if this config row is in the top half of the array. Note that this is only relevant for Series 7 devices.
        Returns:
        True if this config row is in the top of the array, false othewise.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • setTop

        public void setTop(boolean isTop)
        Sets the flag indicating if this config row is in the top half of the array. Note that this is only relevant for Series 7 devices.
        Parameters:
        isTop - True if this config row is in the top of the array, false othewise.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • add

        public boolean add(Block block)
        Adds the provided block to the end of this row of blocks
        Parameters:
        block - The block to add
        Returns:
        True if the row changed as a result of the call
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getBlock

        public Block getBlock(int index)
        Gets the block at the specified index within the row.
        Parameters:
        index - The index into the row from which to retrieve a block
        Returns:
        The block within the row at the specified index
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • numOfBlocks

        public int numOfBlocks()
        Gets the number of blocks in this row.
        Returns:
        The number of blocks in this row.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getBlocks

        public List<Block> getBlocks()
        Gets the raw list of blocks in this config row
        Returns:
        The list of blocks within this config row.
        Since:
        2020.2.1

      • getBlockFromTileColumn

        public Block getBlockFromTileColumn(int tileColumnIdx)
        Gets the block in this configuration row based on the the tile column index in the fabric array.
        Parameters:
        tileColumnIdx - The column index of the tile of interest (See: Tile.getColumn()).
        Returns:
        The corresponding block from the array that matches the tile column index provided or null if none could be found.
        Since:
        2020.2.1
